Package service

Class ServiceCalloutTools

java.lang.Object
service.ServiceCalloutTools
public class ServiceCalloutTools extends Object
ServiceCalloutTools provides utility methods for handling HTTP header and body mutations in Envoy service callouts. These methods are used to construct responses by adding, removing, and modifying headers and bodies, as well as setting HTTP status codes.

  • Method Details

    • addHeaderMutations

      public static void addHeaderMutations(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.HeadersResponse.Builder headersResponseBuilder, Iterable<Map.Entry<String,String>> addHeaders, Iterable<String> removeHeaders, Boolean clearRouteCache, io.envoyproxy.envoy.config.core.v3.HeaderValueOption.HeaderAppendAction appendAction)
      Adds and removes HTTP headers, with optional route cache clearing.

      This method allows headers to be added, removed, and optionally appends header values. The response can also be configured to clear the route cache.

      Parameters:
      headersResponseBuilder - The HeadersResponse.Builder used to build the response.
      addHeaders - A map of header key-value pairs to be added to the response.
      removeHeaders - A list of header keys to be removed from the response.
      clearRouteCache - If true, clears the route cache after applying header changes.
      appendAction - Optional action specifying how to append headers (e.g., replace or append).

    • addBodyMutations

      public static void addBodyMutations(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.BodyResponse.Builder bodyResponseBuilder, String body, Boolean clearBody, Boolean clearRouteCache)
      Modifies the HTTP response body by setting or clearing the body content.

      This method sets the body of the response, or clears the body if no content is provided. Body and clearBody are mutually exclusive—if a body is provided, clearBody is ignored.

      Parameters:
      bodyResponseBuilder - The BodyResponse.Builder used to build the body response.
      body - The body content to be set. If null, the body will not be modified.
      clearBody - If true, clears the body when no body content is provided.
      clearRouteCache - If true, clears the route cache after modifying the body.

    • buildImmediateResponse

      public static void buildImmediateResponse(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.ImmediateResponse.Builder builder, io.envoyproxy.envoy.type.v3.HttpStatus status, com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<String,String> headersToAdd, List<String> headersToRemove, String body)
      Builds an immediate HTTP response by setting the status, headers, and optional body.

      This method modifies an ImmediateResponse.Builder to include an HTTP status, header modifications, and optionally, a response body. Headers can be added and removed.

      Parameters:
      builder - The ImmediateResponse.Builder to modify.
      status - The HttpStatus representing the HTTP status code for the response.
      headersToAdd - A map of header key-value pairs to be added to the response.
      headersToRemove - A list of header keys to be removed from the response.
      body - Optional body content for the response. If null, the body will not be set.

    • denyCallout

      public static void denyCallout(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.HeadersResponse.Builder context, String msg)
      Denies a gRPC callout, optionally logging a custom message.
      Parameters:
      context - The gRPC StreamObserver or other context object.
      msg - Custom message to log before denying the callout. Defaults to "Callout DENIED." if null.
      Throws:
      io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException - Always raised to deny the callout.
